poem:
Title: The Persistence of Adoration

A tantalizing orange,
hanging relentless 
upon the vine of the nation.
The chorus of voices 
rustling in the wheat field, unheeding 
of the wind's caution.
In the clamor we seek psychology, 
when the answer lies within 
the soil and the stubborn heartbeats,
Trump, a weathered icon draws 
us towards a forgotten dawn,
their king in the morning light.
